column4: every time i run apt-get i get it says that packages are not authenticated
then you've added a third party repo without a key, no?
please pastebin the error you're receiving
Have you added a third-party repository?
did you try sudo apt-get update?
are you still trying to fix your repo auth error?
try visiting http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/jaunty-security/main/binary-i386 in a browser. Do you see a directory listing?
essentially, apt-get is finding that that URL is a 404, when clearly it isn't. It isn't your ISP's fault either.
my nickname is Stormx2, not storm x. If you want me to see your messages, use my nick
what did you want me to do after that
to get the contents, hit Alt + F2 and write "gedit /etc/apt/sources.list" (without the quote)
Look, I need you to open a file, select all the text, paste it into pastebin, and give me the link
Uhg. How did you go to open it?
